name: Get RSS Feed
description:
Parse RSS/Atom feeds from any source. Use this for unlimited news aggregation without API limits.

You can:
- Parse any public RSS/Atom feed
- Get articles from multiple feeds at once
- Access unlimited news sources (no API quota)
- Parse custom/niche news sources
- Aggregate content from blogs, podcasts, etc.

No API key required - works with any public RSS feed.
Cache: Not cached (RSS is already fast and unlimited).

Popular RSS feeds:
- TechCrunch: https://techcrunch.com/feed/
- Hacker News: https://news.ycombinator.com/rss
- NYT: https://rss.nytimes.com/services/xml/rss/nyt/HomePage.xml
- BBC: https://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/rss.xml
- Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/{subreddit}/.rss

** WHEN TO USE **
- User wants unlimited news aggregation
- User wants news from specific RSS feeds
- User wants to avoid API quota limits
- User wants niche/custom news sources
- User wants blog/podcast content

** WHEN NOT TO USE **
- User wants curated top headlines (use get_headlines)
- User wants to search news (use search_news)
- User doesn't have specific RSS feed URL

** EXAMPLES **

1. Parse single RSS feed:
{
  "url": "https://techcrunch.com/feed/",
  "maxItems": 20
}

2. Parse multiple feeds:
{
  "urls": [
    "https://techcrunch.com/feed/",
    "https://www.theverge.com/rss/index.xml",
    "https://news.ycombinator.com/rss"
  ],
  "maxItemsPerFeed": 10
}

3. Parse news category feeds:
{
  "category": "technology"
}

url.description: RSS feed URL to parse (single feed)

urls.description: Array of RSS feed URLs to parse (multiple feeds)

category.description: Use popular RSS feeds from this category

maxItems.description: Max items to return from single feed (default: 20)

maxItemsPerFeed.description: Max items per feed when parsing multiple feeds (default: 10)
